sndlib.core.problem
Class OperatingState

java.lang.Object
  sndlib.core.problem.OperatingState

public class OperatingState
extends java.lang.Object

This class represents an operating state in a survivable network design instance. Besides the normal operating state (NOS), in which all links are properly working, only single link failures are considered in SNDlib.

An operating state can be instantiated using on of the static factory methods of this class.

Author:
Roman Klaehne

Field Detail

NOS

public static OperatingState NOS
Constant specifying the normal operationg state, in which all links work properly.

DEFAULT_BACKUP

public static OperatingState DEFAULT_BACKUP
This is a special state used to simplify the definition of state-dependent routings especially in the case of 1+1 dedicated path protection.

This state means: if any link in the NOS-routing of a demand fails and no corresponding backup routing is specified, then the backup routing defined under this state is assumed to be the default.
For 1+1 protection this state is used to define the demand's backup paths.

As an example imagine you have the following routing in the normal operating state (NOS):
   ROUTINGS NOS (
     Demand1 (Link1 Link2)
     Demand2 (Link3)
   )
For every single link failure you have to specify the backup routing which leads to three routing sections:
   ROUTINGS Link1 (
     Demand1 (Link4 Link5)
   )
   ROUTINGS Link2 (
     Demand1 (Link4 Link5)
   )
   ROUTINGS Link3 (
     Demand2 (Link6)
   )
Using the default backup routing state you may abbreviate the definitions of the backup routings:
   ROUTINGS DEFAULT_BACKUP (
     Demand1 (Link4 Link5)
     Demand2 (Link6)
   )
.

Method Detail

singleLinkFailureState

public static OperatingState singleLinkFailureState(java.lang.String linkId)
Constructs an operating state representing the failure of the link with the specified ID.

Parameters:
linkId - the ID of a link
Returns:
an operating state representing the failure of the link with the specified ID
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given link ID equals the name of an predefined operating state (e.g. NOS)

getInstance

public static OperatingState getInstance(java.lang.String stateName)
Returns an appropriate operating state instance corresponding to the given name.
If the specified name equals one of the predefined states (e.g. NOS) the correspondig state is returned.

Parameters:
stateName - the name of the state
Returns:
a predefined state instance or a new constructed operating state representing a single link failure.
